title: Another Patch: Another Bug. Patcher not loading.
body:
So, 

I am on here again. Third time in as many weeks. All I want to do is play some League.

So today, when I try to play league, the Patcher doesn't even load.

Tried to run it in Administrator, tried deleted folders as suggested on the many other threads, but I can't force a repatch like I did last time cause the Patcher won't load at all.

Getting a bit over this, I just want to play your game, and every time I try over the last three weeks, I get a different bug.

I am not even sure I want to reinstall the game anymore.

replies.body:
http://i.imgur.com/chxrJT7.png
> 
> * Please start with the [Patching Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues) guide
> * You can also try the [Launcher Troubleshooting](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1538750) guide
> __________________
> 
> * The servers are actually down, check [Service Status](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/?en_US#na) page, there's usually an announcement.
> * You may need to enable Scripting.
> * Restart your computer
> * Your Internet Explorer may be in offline mode. If so, change it.
> * If you're set to use a proxy server, turn it off:
>  * Internet Options -> Connection -> Lan Settings -> Auto Detect
> * Turn off Certificates in Internet Explorer:
>  * IE Options > Advanced > Restore Advanced Settings
>  * IE Options > Advanced > Uncheck "Check for server certificate authentication"
>  * After successfully logging in, revert your certificate settings back to default to avoid any unnecessary security vulnerability.
> * Run through the [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide in the knowledge base.
> * Try powercycling (restarting) your modem.
> * Reset your internet security settings:
>  * Internet Options->Advanced->Reset Button
> * Make sure your computer's clock is synced [(Windows)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-and-Client-issues-PVP-net-#jwq3) [(Mac)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-and-Client-issues-PVP-net-#jmq3)
> * [Uninstall Pando Media Booster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-and-Client-issues-PVP-net-#jwq9)
> _________________
> 
> * Try running as an admin by right clicking on the icon and selecting "Run As" and "Administrator"
> * Make sure your [Internet Security Settings](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202536660-Issues-with-the-League-of-Legends-Store-PvP-Net-#jwq2) are set properly.
> * If you recently did a system restore, had a virus or did a Windows reinstall, you may want to try [Reinstalling League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends).
> * Run through the RADS Fix in [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHcfG9RV9Rw)
> * Try changing your screen resolution to 1024x768 [(Windows)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues#jwq1) [(Mac)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues#jmq1)
> ________________
> 
> * The game needs to be installed in a subdirectory in order to work properly
> * You might have been logged in during downtime, try again in a bit
> ______________
> 
> * Restart your computer, then restart the patcher process and let it sit.
> * Go to your Riot Games/RADS/System folder under your default install path, right click and run the rads_user_kernel.exe file and run as Admin.
> * Try deleting your LoL_Air_Client folder (the default install path for this folder is C:\Riot Games\RADS\Projects) and then repatching.
> * See this article, about changing to a public DNS [(Windows)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#jwq4) [(Mac)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#jmq3)
> * Hit the Windows button and in the search bar type "cmd" and hit "OK". In the new window, type
>  * netsh winsock reset
>  * then hit enter and restart your computer.
> * Replace /RADS/system/rads_user_kernel.exe, with [this file](http://l3cdn.riotgames.com/releases/live/system/rads_user_kernel.exe)
> * Try installing [Microsoft Dot NET Framework 4.0](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851) and [Dot NET 3.5](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=21)
> * Try running through the RADS solution in [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHcfG9RV9Rw)
> __________________
> 
> * Let the launcher run for up to 15 minutes
> * Restart the launcher
> * Powercycle (restart) your modem and/or router
> * Make sure that lol.launcher.exe is listed as an exception in your firewall
> * Temporarily disable firewall and anti-virus software.
> * Click on the gear icon in the upper right of the launcher window and try the repair option.
> * Turn off Peer to Peer Transfer in your launcher options
> * Did you visit the [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) article in the knowledge base?
> * Try [reinstalling League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)
> ________________
> 
> * Make sure you have the most current [Windows Updates](http://www.update.microsoft.com/windowsupdate/v6/thanks.aspx?ln=en&&thankspage=5)
> * Make sure you have [Microsoft Dot NET Framework 3.5](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=21), or uninstall then reinstall your Dot NET Framework.
> * If you are running Windows Vista/Windows 7 make sure the install path is NOT in Program Files
> * Are you having a [connection failure](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) when logging in?
> * [Reinstall League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)
> ______________
> 
> * Make sure you have the most current [Windows Updates](http://www.update.microsoft.com/windowsupdate/v6/thanks.aspx?ln=en&&thankspage=5)
> * Make sure you have [Microsoft Dot NET Framework 3.5](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=21), or uninstall then reinstall your Dot NET Framework.
> * Install [Microsoft C++ Redistributable x86](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=8328) [(x64 Version)](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=13523)
> * [Reinstall League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)
> ______________________
> 
> * Close any instances of PVP.net or the LoL launcher and restart your patcher. Allow it to complete.
> * After the patch process finishes, hit the button with 2 gears in the upper right corner of your patcher and complete the repair process.
> * If you are able to login, you may also want to try starting a custom game to see if you're still getting the version rejected error.
> * If that did not work, close your launcher and Delete lol_air_client and lol_launcher from ...\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects
> * [Uninstall Pando Media Booster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues#jwq9)
> * Make sure you have the most current [Windows Updates](http://www.update.microsoft.com/windowsupdate/v6/thanks.aspx?ln=en&&thankspage=5)
> * Try running the game as an administrator
>  * Right click on the executable and select "Run As" "Administrator"
> ______________
> 
> * Reinstall your Video Card and Network Drivers
> * You may have bad memory/need to downclock your RAM, check your memory with [MemTest](http://www.memtest86.com/)
> * If you are getting a Blue Screen of Death please post a thread in Help & Support with a zipped copy of your .dmp crash log (...\Windows\Minidump)
> _______________
> 
> * Your Active Scripting may be disabled. Go to:
>  * Internet Options -> Security -> Active scripting (near the bottom) -> Enable -> OK.
>  * Restart the launcher.
> * Go to your projects folder (...\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects) and delete the lol_air_client and lol_launcher folders, then restart your patcher.
> * Try turning off UAC in Windows 7/Vista (NOTE: does not apply to XP)
> ______________
> 
> * Powercycle (restart) your modem and router
> * Try plugging directly into your modem if you use a router.
> * Reinstall your network card drivers.
> * [Reinstall League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)
> * Make sure your ports are open.
> * Make sure you forwarded the correct ports on your router [(Windows)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#jwq7) [(Mac)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#jmq6)
> * Check with your ISP about packet loss issues or blocking
> * If your Peer to Peer is blocked, try [Hotspot Shield](http://www.hotspotshield.com/)

I tried all of those things.

I uninstalled and Reinstalled for the third time in as many weeks.

Please for the love of Godyr, let this be the last time.

I am now back online, but very, very dissatisfied.

do you use Avast antivirus?  if yes, try this
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/n0ZyPFxd-solution-cant-log-in-avast-may-be-blocking-league
